intro: Bellevalia stepporum var. stepporum, commonly known as the steppe bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the steppes of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces tall, unbranched stems that bear clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or purple. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine plantings.
